item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

You’d have to use a double instead of an int. Again this goes back to learning the basics of a programming language. There’s no harm in educating yourself in the language you want to program in.

item.description:
@modzilla wrote:

Yea ive tried everything from changing Variables in parent classes to changing everything in its own class. I cant convert…
Beside that fact, is it possible to make a monster drop only 1 item not all of them? because when i kill a goblin he will drop like 6 herbs a few gems ect. The items all have like a 5% rate. You know what i mean?

item.title: NPC Drop Help
item.dc:creator: @modzilla modzilla
item.description:
@modzilla wrote:

Basically I need to be able to assign a decimal value to the drop ratio to this code:

[code]public static final int[] UNDEAD_NPCS = {90,91,92,93,94,103,104,73,74,75,76,77};
public static final int[][] NPC_DROPS = {

/*	NPC/ID/AMOUNT/POSSIBILITY */
		// Man 1
		{1, 526, 1, 0}, {1, 1438, 1, 7}, {1, 1965, 1, 10}, {1, 1440, 1, 6}, {1, 199, 1, 1}, {1, 201, 1, 1}, {1, 203, 1, 1}, {1, 205, 1, 1}, {1, 207, 1, 1}, {1, 209, 1, 1}, {1, 211, 1, 1}, 
		{1, 213, 1, 1}, {1, 215, 1, 1}, {1, 217, 1, 1}, {1, 219, 1, 1}, {1, 882, 3 + Misc.random(7), 5}, {1, 562, 2, 4}, {1, 554, 6, 4}, {1, 1203, 1, 2}, {1, 877, 3 + Misc.random(4), 3},
		{1, 313, 1 + Misc.random(4), 3}, {1, 1139, 1, 1}, {1, 436, 1, 1}, {1, 995, 1 + Misc.random(25), 10},[/code]

So if i want the man to drop bones like 1 in 1000 chance i would change {1, 526, 1, 0} to {1, 526, 1, .1}
I get an error because it is assigned as an int. if i change ot to a double i get errors and says something about parsing.
Anyone know how to make it decimals?

Read full topic
